page.title: 07PURLEY C OF E INFANT SCHOOL
page.content: Purley school was built in 1873 and first opened as a school for all local children between the ages of four to fourteen.It now serves as an infant school for up to 60 pupils between the ages of 5 and 7.The Purley children transfer to{Long Lane Primary School}. The main building is constructed of red brick and flint,there is also a terrapin classroom added in 1962.The Victorian outside toilets have been converted for storage use and is a listed building.There are two teaching staff and a secretary.There is also a mother who comes on the computer with the infant children every Wednesday. The secretary and head teacher share a very small office which originally served as the girls' entrance lobby!
